Articles.Content: While watching my ore refinery on the Mun teeter on the brink of meltdown, a thought occurred to me. Why can't this heat be harnessed into thermoelectric power? Granted, it might seem cheaty to do so, since a refinery and drills would provide unlimited heat, but it seems like it might be feasible. Perhaps, to keep it from being too OP, the power output could be low-level, with a chance of the generator itself exploding due to overheating. I dunno, I'm not a modder, but I figured I'd throw that out there.
Why would it be cheating? You're basically heating a working fluid to drive a turbine and then cooling the working fluid. You still need to get rid of tue waste heat but you're putting it to use.

Well, "cheating" is subjective, I suppose. I personally don't think it is, since you're using something readily available, but it definitely renders solar power obsolete on surface bases with refineries given the ubiquitousness of heat in the game now.

Developing the idea further, maybe the generator could also serve as a radiator. Nertea made some heatpipes in his NFElectrical pack, and they act like fuel lines or struts in the way you put them on your ship. Maybe one could be developed using the KAS pipe model, allowing you to build a power generator/heat radiator module for your base, and connect it to your other modules via KAS-powered heatpipes.
